main event: A family in Marrero, Louisiana reported seeing a round, star-like object that changed color from white to pink and green, circling at a high rate of speed without any sound or exhaust.
interesting points: The object was observed visually for 18 minutes prior to 12:32 CST on November 14, 1957.
The object was estimated to be directly overhead at an altitude of star level.
The object left behind a thin, high smoke trail that was about 12 knots long.
There was no known air traffic or meteorological phenomenon in the area at the time.
The sighting lasted for 3 to 5 seconds.
sighted object: round, star-like object that changed color from white to pink and green
